vectorData.altText: 8. Many muscles of the _____________ compartment of the forearm have the word “extensor” in their name.
That's right!  The muscles of the posterior compartment of the forearm extend the wrist and joints of the digits.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

The second muscle that supinates the forearm, in addition to the biceps brachii, is also in this compartment. It is called the supinator     . 
Because these are the primary actions of the muscles of the posterior compartment of the forearm, it is described, functionally, as the “extensor-supinator compartment”.
All muscles in this compartment are innervated by the radial nerve     . 
The muscles are organized into two layers. 
The superficial layer consists of six muscles (red). One acts act the elbow. The others extend the wrist and fingers.

Tendons arising from the muscles of the posterior compartment of the forearm cross the posterior aspect of the wrist and digits, and therefore act to extend the wrist, MCP, PIP and DIP joints. Many of these muscles have the word extensor in their names.
There are four muscles in the deep layer, two of which are seen at the level of this cross section. Three muscles of this layer act on the thumb, and the fourth acts on the index finger.
